reviewText: Watched by high school students for educational learning-they view was it was narrated well, good visual examples, and they wished there would have been more examples of the recycling concept. Accents were hard to understand at times.
I enjoyed learning about living as a more responsible and resourceful resident of this planet.
Possibly one of the most important bodies of information regarding the challenges of building cities which are solving problems rather than creating more of them.
This is a great series, although a lot of the episodes don't feature the "greenest" of designs.
The entire e2 design series is great.  this has been a wonderful teaching tool for environemtal science.

I bought it as a gift for Christmas because it was on the list my sister gave me. She was very happy to get it, but seemed disappointed that it was only one disc with 6 episodes. I was stunned to open it when it arrived to see that I had paid $25 for one disc. But if someone really wants it, I guess what else are you going to do? As a gift, I probably would have opted for a gift that gave a little more for my money.
